intro: Ducrosia inaccessa, commonly known as the inaccessible ducrosia, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant is known for its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Ducrosia inaccessa thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
